thread.title: Western PA residents question proposed wild animal park
thread.title_full: Western PA residents question proposed wild animal park

title: Western PA residents question proposed wild animal park
text:
Liberty Township residents still concerned about proposed wild animal safari park 
THE ASSOCIATED PRESS Published: 7/7/15 3:54 pm EDT - Updated: 7/7/15 3:58 pm EDT 
GROVE CITY, Pennsylvania â€” Residents of a western Pennsylvania township are voicing concerns over the planned construction of a 143-acre safari park scheduled to open next summer. 
The Pittsburgh Tribune-Review reports ( http://bit.ly/1JS9941 ) Liberty Township held hearings in November where residents discussed issues with the proposed Living Treasures Wild Animal Park. Among those included traffic, safety, privacy and potential water contamination. 
Residents using well-water systems are worried that waste from the wild animal park could contaminate the soil and water stored underground. 
Despite the questions raised, the township granted 29-year-old owner Adam Guiher a conditional-use permit that allows him to use the land for the park provided he follows the necessary federal and state regulations for operation. 
Guiher says the park located near Grove City about 45 miles north of Pittsburgh will house 100 species. 
Information from: Pittsburgh Tribune-Review, http://pghtrib.com
